channel.title: Troubleshooting on Security365 Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Troubleshooting on Security365 Docs

item.title: Increase logging for Railgun
item.description: Increase logging for RailgunWhen troubleshooting or testing the Railgun Listener, it may be necessary to raise the level of verbosity to capture more log data for debugging. To increase logging, set the log.level within railgun.conf to 5 so that all events within the listener instance are captured during troubleshooting. NoteThe Railgun service running on the server will also need to be restarted. For changes to take effect, open a terminal window and run the following command:

item.title: Potential problems
item.description: Potential problemsIf you notice consistent 523, 524, or other error responses, check the System Status Map External link icon Open external link and contact support if needed. Railgun will fall back to direct HTTP requests if Cloudflare’s endpoints cannot contact your Railgun daemon, but consistent error responses may indicate a system or origin server problem. When contacting support, please provide a screenshot of http://www.yourdomain.com/cdn-cgi/trace if possible, or a traceroute External link icon Open external link to your domain so Cloudflare knows which data center your requests are reaching.
